intro: Chaetanthera spathulifolia, commonly known as the broad-leafed chaetanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbel-like clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
